intro: Potamogeton cristatus, commonly known as the hairy water plant or spiked pondweed, is a submerged aquatic plant native to freshwater environments in Europe and Asia. It has long, ribbon-like leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces small, green flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, and it is often found in shallow, slow-moving waters. Potamogeton cristatus plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms. It is also used in phytoremediation due to its ability to absorb heavy metals from the water.
